SEARCH
Package pl.put.poznan.sortingMadness.logic

Class BubbleSort

java.lang.Object
pl.put.poznan.sortingMadness.logic.BubbleSort
All Implemented Interfaces:
SortingInterface
public class BubbleSort extends Object implements SortingInterface
The BubbleSort class implements the Bubble Sort algorithm. This algorithm sorts a list by repeatedly stepping through the list, comparing adjacent elements, and swapping them if they are in the wrong order. The process is repeated until the list is sorted. This implementation supports sorting in both ascending and descending order.

    • sort

      public <T> SortResult<T> sort(ArrayList<T> data, Comparator<? super T> comparator, boolean descOrder)
      Sorts the given list of data using the Bubble Sort algorithm. The method sorts the data either in ascending or descending order based on the provided descOrder parameter.
      Specified by:
      sort in interface SortingInterface
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      data - the list of elements to be sorted
      comparator - the comparator defining the sorting order
      descOrder - if true, sorts the data in descending order; otherwise, in ascending order
      Returns:
      a SortResult containing the sorted data and the time taken for sorting (in nanoseconds)
